tn.text: fifth year ... fourteenth year** - (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

Here "our" refers to Ezekiel and the Israelites who have been in Babylon since the time the Babylonians forced King Jehoiachin to leave Jerusalem. AT: "after we became captives" or "after the Babylonians took us as captives to Babylon." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclusive]])

tn.ref: the beginning of the year on the tenth day of the month
tn.text: This is the first month of the Hebrew calendar. The tenth day is in April on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
AT: "the Babylonians captured the city of Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
See how you translated "the hand of Yahweh" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:3]].
"He put me down"
"Yahweh brought me to the place that had the buildings"
The word "behold" here shows that Ezekiel was surprised by what he saw.
"a rope made of linen." This is a tool for measuring very long distances.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:09:01|9:2]].
This is a tool for measuring shorter distances.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]].
AT: "pay attention to" or "think about." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]].
"going all the way around the temple area"
"six cubits long." This was about 3.2 meters. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: each "long" cubit equaling a cubit and a handbreadth
tn.text: Each long cubit was about 54 centimeters. You may choose not to include this information if you give modern measurements instead of "cubits" as the UDB does. AT: "these were the long cubits, which were the length of a regular cubit plus a handbreadth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
"the width of a hand." This was about 8 centimeters. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
"how wide the wall was." The wall was hollow like a building.
"it was one stick wide." This was about 3.2 meters.
AT: "and one stick high"
"and he went up the steps of the gate"
"from the front edge of the threshold to the back edge"
These were rooms that were built inside of the gate where guards stayed to protect the gate.
about 2.7 meters (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: between any two of the chambers
tn.text: "between the rooms"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:08:16|8:16]].
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:08:16|8:16]].

About one meter. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

"were the same size"
"the opening which was the entrance of the gate"

about thirty-two meters. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.text: "the windows were all around on the inside"

The word "behold" here shows us that Ezekiel saw something interesting.
a flat floor that is made out of rocks

tn.text: AT: "and there were thirty rooms all around the pavement." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Two-pronged hooks a handbreadth long were fastened in the portico all around
tn.text: pronged hooks a handbreadth long were fastened in the portico all around** - AT: "All around the portico, people had attached hooks that were a handbreadth long and had two prongs each" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
pronged hooks** - something that has two long curved points, which people can hang things on
about eight centimeters. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]]).

tn.ref: the flesh of the offerings would be put on the tables
tn.text: AT: "they would put the flesh of the offerings on the tables"
This is the inner gate on the north.
"rooms for singers" However, come ancient and modern versions read only "chambers," leaving out the idea of singers.
This phrase means "The room that has its main entrance on the south side." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: who are on duty in the temple
tn.text: AT: "who are working in the temple" (UDB) or "who are responsible for guarding the temple"
The man continues speaking to Ezekiel in the vision.
